About the Channel

Joe Marano is a West Norfolk-based wildlife photographer who has been featured by the BBC for his work. Creating content on both Facebook and YouTube, Joe focuses on accessible wildlife photography, showing that you don‚Äôt need to travel to exotic locations to capture stunning images. His passion is British wildlife, particularly birds, and he shares his knowledge generously with the community.

Content Style

  • British wildlife focus - showcasing local species
  • Garden photography tips and techniques
  • Accessible approach - you don‚Äôt need exotic locations
  • OM System gear demonstrations and reviews
  • Practical tutorials for everyday photographers
  • Behind-the-scenes of wildlife photography work

Why We Recommend This Channel

Joe‚Äôs approach to wildlife photography is refreshingly down-to-earth. Rather than focusing on expensive safaris or rare species, he demonstrates how incredible wildlife photography opportunities exist right in your own backyard. His BBC recognition validates the quality of his work, while his willingness to share techniques makes his channel invaluable for aspiring wildlife photographers in the UK and beyond.

Best For

  • British wildlife photographers
  • Garden bird photography enthusiasts
  • Those starting in wildlife photography
  • OM System/Olympus users
  • Learning accessible, local wildlife photography
  • Understanding British bird species and behavior

Photography Philosophy

Joe believes in the power of local wildlife photography and proving that you don‚Äôt need to travel far to capture amazing images. His work celebrates the beauty of British wildlife and encourages others to appreciate and photograph the nature around them.

BBC Recognition

Joe‚Äôs work has been featured by the BBC, recognizing his contribution to wildlife photography and his ability to showcase British wildlife in compelling ways. This recognition speaks to both his technical skill and his eye for capturing natural moments.

Community Support

Joe creates content independently and isn‚Äôt financially compensated by major brands, making his channel a genuine passion project. He accepts community support through platforms like Buy Me a Coffee to help continue creating educational content.
